body: Great, it would be better to add a simple document to describe how to use it. And you can use this script to commit this PR to verify this PR as well. Maybe after jira system is created, so that we can verify whether jira updating works.
Thanks @zjffdu , I already verified PR merging with my own repo, so it should be worked. The only missing part is to verify JIRA system. I will verify it when JIRA is ready.

Hi @ajbozarth , let's wait for the Travis is ready. Currently we still have some infra issues during moving to Apache.

Besides lets keep the PR title convention: LIVY-xxx. xxxx

@jerryshao I'll change the names back (used the Spark way by habit) and I figured reviews wouldn't go through until testing is set up, I've been staying in the loop on the move progress (Luciano sits next to me).

I think the code is fine to me. Just requires Travis to run again to make sure every thing is fine. 

Currently Travis on incubator-livy is not ready, I already created a ticket about this (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-14468). Can we please wait for some additional days? Sorry about the long delay.
Thanks for the link and the delay is nbd, it's actually given me time to focus on an import side project of mine.
Actually the title should be (LIVY-365. xxx) :).
Ack, only one i messed up too >.<

(unrelated to here) We should also consider ACLs when exposing this either on the UI or other places, it's not good to let others without permission to see the codes.

Another thing is that we should carefully modify REST APIs, this will potentially break usr's assumption. It might be OK for now since we're still in 0.4 version, but we still should think carefully about the necessity to change the API.

Thanks for the feedback @jerryshao I agree that we should be careful of modifying API and as you said, if this wasn't 0.4 I would have turned down the idea. As for ACLs this API call already checks for them, so currently the UI fails to display the statements table when ACLs are turned on (this is in the next PR I will be opening).

As for the necessity issue, this was requested in the user list plus, as I mentioned in the description, in the new Web UI (in a PR not yet opened that's waiting on #3 to merge) the statement table can be confusing to understand with only a result and no input code for context. With the assumption that as Livy moves forward more users will rely on the UI to read through old statements (as seen in Spark) an addition like this in v0.X is net positive in my eyes.

The behavior of Spark is the same as Livy:

```
spark_rotate_log ()
{
    log=$1;
    num=5;
    if [ -n "$2" ]; then
        num=$2
    fi
    if [ -f "$log" ]; then # rotate logs
        while [ $num -gt 1 ]; do
            prev=`expr $num - 1`
            [ -f "$log.$prev" ] && mv "$log.$prev" "$log.$num"
            num=$prev
        done
        mv "$log" "$log.$num";
    fi
}
```

So the more I think about it, Spark is a unique case where the documentation is kept in the main repo then built and copied into the website repo. For most smaller projects I've seen where there's only a few files, like Livy, the docs are storied in the website. So I'm going to sleep on it and might open up the question to the dev list tomorrow.

My concern is that if we keep document in another repo, we may forget to update docs in another repo when we change some API related things in code.

Sure we can bring this out in mail list to hear about others. But thinking is putting things not frequently changed in livy-website repo, whereas API reference, configuration docs in main repo.

@jerryshao Earlier my plan was to use LDAP authentication supported by Hadoop auth library of 2.8+ version. But it didn't work well with our setup LDAP setup. Here I have implemented LDAP authentication which is working similar to that but with less restriction. I have fixed all the comments and also removed whatever code was not needed. There are couple of methods which are inherited from AuthenticationHandler interface. So I need to keep those. Init and Destroy methods are called from AuthenticationFilter. Can you please review recent changes?

While we're discussing where to keep the Docs on the mailing list I made a minor update to the order and wording of the REAME. If we decide to keep the Docs here I'll move them back over in this PR and setup a way to display them on the website in a separate PR
